body: @hcaseyal The test suites found the memory [leaks](https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/68bbd049-f56b-4bd5-adbf-ec6283adf379/log). So I'm going to restore the bug fix.
@vertextao Awesome! Nice work. Let me know when your code is ready for a review

@hcaseyal The previous bug fix had been restored, the code is ready for a review.
I'm expecting your advices.
@hcaseyal by the way, I did the same thing on *gpr_cv* in my modifications.
@hcaseyal I checked the tests' results. More memory leaks were detected. Should I fix them in this PR or in a new PR?
@vertextao It is preferable if you can fix the leaks in this PR, since it includes the test for them. It's great that your test is catching these leaks! Nice work üëç

@hcaseyal I've made a new commit to fix the problems discussed above. 

But there's some build issues when trying to run the ASAN tests on my environments (Mac and Linux). 

For example:

```
$ CONFIG=asan make h2_full_test
[C]       Compiling third_party/zlib/adler32.c
In file included from third_party/zlib/adler32.c:8:
In file included from third_party/zlib/zutil.h:22:
third_party/zlib/zlib.h:1420:9: error: unknown type name 'z_size_t'
ZEXTERN z_size_t ZEXPORT gzfread OF((voidp buf, z_size_t size, z_size_t nitems,
        ^
third_party/zlib/zlib.h:1420:49: error: unknown type name 'z_size_t'
ZEXTERN z_size_t ZEXPORT gzfread OF((voidp buf, z_size_t size, z_size_t nitems,
                                                ^
third_party/zlib/zlib.h:1420:64: error: unknown type name 'z_size_t'
ZEXTERN z_size_t ZEXPORT gzfread OF((voidp buf, z_size_t size, z_size_t nitems,
                                                               ^
third_party/zlib/zlib.h:1454:9: error: unknown type name 'z_size_t'
ZEXTERN z_size_t ZEXPORT gzfwrite OF((voidpc buf, z_size_t size,
        ^
third_party/zlib/zlib.h:1454:51: error: unknown type name 'z_size_t'
ZEXTERN z_size_t ZEXPORT gzfwrite OF((voidpc buf, z_size_t size,
                                                  ^
third_party/zlib/zlib.h:1455:39: error: unknown type name 'z_size_t'
                                      z_size_t nitems, gzFile file));
                                      ^
third_party/zlib/zlib.h:1708:37: error: unknown type name 'z_size_t'
                                    z_size_t len));
                                    ^
third_party/zlib/zlib.h:1743:35: error: unknown type name 'z_size_t'
                                  z_size_t len));
                                  ^
third_party/zlib/zlib.h:1904:51: error: unknown type name 'va_list'
                                                  va_list va));
                                                  ^
third_party/zlib/adler32.c:66:5: error: expected function body after function declarator
    z_size_t len;
    ^
third_party/zlib/adler32.c:66:17: error: extra ';' outside of a function [-Werror,-Wextra-semi]
    z_size_t len;
                ^
third_party/zlib/adler32.c:67:1: error: expected identifier or '('
{
^
12 errors generated.
```

It's OK when without the `asan` config.

My env:

```
$ clang -v
clang version 7.0.1 
Target: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
Thread model: posix
InstalledDir: /usr/local/bin
Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/i686-redhat-linux/4.8.2
Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/i686-redhat-linux/4.8.5
Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/4.8.2
Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/4.8.5
Selected GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/4.8.5
Candidate multilib: .;@m64
Candidate multilib: 32;@m32
Selected multilib: .;@m64
```

Can you set Kokoro to run the tests?

Thanks!

@vertextao Could you try the suggestions in https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/11581? It seems others have had this build issue in the past and were able to resolve it.

I've just set the Kokoro tests to run.

@hcaseyal I've run the tests on MacOS, there's an issue [#17992](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/17992) posted to discuss about it.

And I missed some leaks, I'll continue fixing them.

@hcaseyal By the way, there are data races found in test code by TSAN tests, I appended the fix in this PR.

The TSAN test output:

```
WARNING: ThreadSanitizer: data race (pid=80722)
  Write of size 4 at 0x00010dd6c2b0 by main thread:
    #0 reset_now_offset() time_change_test.cc:83 (time_change_test:x86_64+0x10000f428)
    #1 grpc::testing::(anonymous namespace)::TimeChangeTest::TearDown() time_change_test.cc:145 (time_change_test:x86_64+0x100007056)

  Previous read of size 4 at 0x00010dd6c2b0 by thread T6 (mutexes: write M0, write M99):
    #0 now_impl(gpr_clock_type) time_change_test.cc:61 (time_change_test:x86_64+0x100001932)
    #1 gpr_now time_posix.cc:144 (time_change_test:x86_64+0x10026b2fb)
    #2 gpr_convert_clock_type time.cc:257 (time_change_test:x86_64+0x10026af11)

    #4 wait_until(long long) timer_manager.cc:209 (time_change_test:x86_64+0x10013d1b8)
    #5 timer_main_loop() timer_manager.cc:263 (time_change_test:x86_64+0x10013cc8f)
    #6 timer_thread(void*) timer_manager.cc:292 (time_change_test:x86_64+0x10013c8c4)
    #7 grpc_core::(anonymous namespace)::ThreadInternalsPosix::ThreadInternalsPosix(char const*, void (*)(void*), void*, bool*)::'lambda'(void*)::operator()(void*) const thd_posix.cc:100 (time_change_test:x86_64+0x10026d479)

@vertextao Looks good, thanks. I have set Kokoro to run tests again
@hcaseyal I forgot to execute the code format script before. And more detected leaks were fixed in this commit.

@hcaseyal More issue caught in previous test [results](https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/4fb83d68-9f6d-4ccc-81ef-d088865ff869/targets/github%2Fgrpc%2Fc_linux_tsan_native_x64_clang7.0/tests).

This issue seems not a leak, it looks like an object life cycle management issue.

```
WARNING: ThreadSanitizer: use of an invalid mutex (e.g. uninitialized or destroyed) (pid=15670)
    #0 pthread_mutex_lock /tmp/clang-build/src/compiler-rt/lib/tsan/../sanitizer_common/sanitizer_common_interceptors.inc:4001:3 (concurrent_connectivity_test+0x4c88ce)

    #5 grpc_core::(anonymous namespace)::PickFirst::UpdateLocked(grpc_channel_args const&, grpc_json*) /var/local/git/grpc/src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/lb_policy/pick_first/pick_first.cc:389:41 (concurrent_connectivity_test+0x6dc9be)

    #7 grpc_core::(anonymous namespace)::PickFirst* grpc_core::New<grpc_core::(anonymous namespace)::PickFirst, grpc_core::LoadBalancingPolicy::Args>(grpc_core::LoadBalancingPolicy::Args&&) /var/local/git/grpc/./src/core/lib/gprpp/memory.h:47:18 (concurrent_connectivity_test+0x6dc009)
    #8 grpc_core::(anonymous namespace)::PickFirstFactory::CreateLoadBalancingPolicy(grpc_core::LoadBalancingPolicy::Args) const /var/local/git/grpc/src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/lb_policy/pick_first/pick_first.cc:623:47 (concurrent_connectivity_test+0x6dbebf)

    #10 grpc_core::RequestRouter::CreateNewLbPolicyLocked(char const*, grpc_json*, grpc_connectivity_state*, grpc_error**, grpc_core::InlinedVector<char*, 3ul>*) /var/local/git/grpc/src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/request_routing.cc:683:7 (concurrent_connectivity_test+0x5879d0)
    #11 grpc_core::RequestRouter::OnResolverResultChangedLocked(void*, grpc_error*) /var/local/git/grpc/src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/request_routing.cc:841:13 (concurrent_connectivity_test+0x586c6e)
    #12 grpc_combiner_continue_exec_ctx() /var/local/git/grpc/src/core/lib/iomgr/combiner.cc:268:5 (concurrent_connectivity_test+0x5bb6a2)

@vertextao interesting... @AspirinSJL @markdroth , could you take a look at the previous comment detailing a sanitizer failure in load balancing code?
I suspect this is related to @AspirinSJL's recent change to C++-ify the subchannel code.  It may be related to #18008.
Looks like yet another issue caused by #17879.

Another aborted test case:

```
Caught signal SIGABRT
test/core/end2end/h2_http_proxy_test[0x43a025]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpthread.so.0(+0x11390)[0x7f70f6646390]

@hcaseyal I've appended more fixed leaks caught in the tests and rebased my commits onto the fresh `origin/master`
@vertextao, thanks, looks good to me. Running tests now.

@hcaseyal @soheilhy I did some simple tests, it can't report the leak of root region registration.

Did I missed anything or misused ?

Thanks!

Tests detail:
```
[root@test146 tmp]# cat 1.cc
#include <stdlib.h>
#include <sanitizer/lsan_interface.h>
int main(int argc, char** argv) {
  int* pi = (int*)malloc(4);
  __lsan_register_root_region(pi, 4);
  free(pi);
}
[root@test146 tmp]# clang++ -g -fsanitize=address -fno-omit-frame-pointer 1.cc; ASAN_OPTIONS=detect_leaks=1 ./a.out
[root@test146 tmp]# clang++ -g -fsanitize=address -fno-omit-frame-pointer 1.cc; LSAN_OPTIONS=verbosity=1:log_threads=1:report_objects=1 ./a.out

@soheilhy OK! I've reverted the changes. For convenience, I keep the Kokoro's failed checks' URLs here, cause there's a `heap-use-after-free` error information that may be useful.
* [Asan C (internal CI)](https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/aced2150-0252-4baa-830e-ffb5111f892d)
* [Bazel RBE ASAN C/C++](https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/941d986e-8c5a-4db2-a51b-7e215a595705)
* [Bazel RBE TSAN C/C++](https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/5e4ce50e-1fc5-4943-b443-8d9cd6aef8ee)
* [Sanity Checks (internal CI)](https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/feaaddee-a736-41c7-b5c6-7afa6c464ea2)

@hcaseyal There was a failure in previous test [results](https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/6ab4a4f3-8c22-4d67-a861-8e4b629b96c5/targets/%2F%2Ftest%2Fcpp%2Futil:grpc_tool_test@poller%3Dpoll-cv/log) referring to `GrpcToolTest.ListOneMethod`, but I can't reproduce this error in my local environment. Please let the Kokoro run again.

Thanks!

@soheilhy Thanks for your review! Changes have been committed. 

The tests reported `[06:37:21][ERROR] Cannot check out non-mergeable pull request as if merged`, what does it mean?

> @soheilhy Thanks for your review! Changes have been committed.

thank you.

> The tests reported `[06:37:21][ERROR] Cannot check out non-mergeable pull request as if merged`, what does it mean?

Please rebase on HEAD.
@soheilhy rebased.

Tests summary:

* [Bazel RBE MSAN C/C++](
https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/da6a1104-47f9-4eaf-ba0b-b9cebf41d43f)
  - It reported `use-of-uninitialized-value`
  - According to the log, it looks like a `use-after-deleted` issue.
  - *I can't reproduce this issue locally.*

* [Bazel RBE UBSAN C/C++](
https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/e7ba8da3-7293-4f98-9f41-285c08da376d)
  - Connect failed
  - Failed to free 1 iomgr objects before shutdown deadline: memory leaks are likely
  - Resource clean issue when shutting down.
  - *I can't reproduce this issue locally.*

* [Sanity Checks (internal CI)](
https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/65c4914e-883d-4b7d-afbc-1d78cdf88880)
  - failed to detect port server
  - Command '['git', 'status', '--porcelain']' returned non-zero exit status -7
  - *I can't reproduce this issue locally.*

@hcaseyal @soheilhy What's your suggestion about these failures?

Thanks!
msan failure is issue #17448 but ubsan and sanity checks seem to be tool failures. I respawned those two for you.
They all pass. The only failing test is the known failure. I'll merge this.
@hcaseyal @soheilhy Thank you for your guide and review!
@vertextao thank you for all your work and cooperation :)
